channel.title: nature on VRchina.cc
channel.description: Recent content in nature on VRchina.cc

item.title: Mount Tai
item.description: The leader of the “Five Sacred Mountains”, Mt. Tai is located in the center of Shandong Province, lying across the cities of Tai’an, Jinan, and Zibo. Its main peak, Jade Emperor Summit, which is within Tai’an City, is about 1,532.

item.title: Chinese River Dolphin
item.description: The Chinese river dolphin is a freshwater dolphin and one of the most endangered animals on Earth. It is also known as the Yangtze River dolphin, baiji, white-flag dolphin, and white-fin dolphin.

item.title: Crested Ibis
item.description: The crested ibis is a rare and precious species in the world. In history, crested ibises were widely distributed in East Asia. Since the middle of the 20th century, its population has reduced rapidly due to the change of the inadaptable environment caused by human activities, such as the decrease of the rice fields, the wide applications of fertilizers and pesticides and the reduction of forest area.

item.title: Dove Tree
item.description: The Dove Tree is a medium-sized deciduous tree, usually placed in the tupelo family, but is sometimes included in the dogwood family, and by yet others given the family status of its own, as Davidiaceae.

item.title: Ginkgo
item.description: When we think about flowering plants, there are about 350,000 living species. And in an evolutionary sense, they’re equivalent to that one species of ginkgo. They’re all more closely related to each other than they are to anything else.

item.title: Golden Snub-nosed Monkey
item.description: The beautiful golden snub-nosed monkey has blackish-grey shoulders, upper arms, back, crown, and tail, with the back being covered in a longer layer of fine silver hairs. In males, the sides of the head, forehead, and neck and underparts are a bright golden color, hence the common name of this species.

item.title: Yangtze River and the Yellow River Â
item.description: Yangtze River Winding about 3,964 miles, the Yangtze River is the largest in China and the third-largest river in the world after the Nile in Africa and the Amazon in South America.
